comments.author: diane
comments.content: since i'm eating vegan style these days, i wonder how these would be without the feta?

comments.author: Kirsten
comments.content: Perfect! Saved me from having to figure out the item for the next inevitable potluck that comes with being a school mom. Diane - I bet it would be delish without feta or you could sub with pine nuts or walnuts ... or take it in a slightly different direction with cherry tomatoes.

comments.author: Rochelle @ WheatlessRochelle.com
comments.content: I love everything in this salad. It sounds like a great combo. I've pinned it to make later. Thanks!

comments.author: Kalyn
comments.content:
I'm crazy about fresh marjoram.  Will be one of the first herbs I plant at my new house.

Great recipe!

comments.author: Joan Kutcher
comments.content: Now I can't wait to plant more green beans. And marjoram.What would this be like with mint? Last season I ran out of ideas for the bean crop, but that was before I knew about your great site.

comments.author: Maria Tadic
comments.content: I love green beans with feta.  I don't know what it is, but its delicious!  I like the addition of the kalamata olives.  Yum!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Mint would be fantastic in it, as would oregano or thyme.

comments.author: broach
comments.content:
Adding a bit of orange zest made the taste wow, wow. The kalamata olives also made the salad.

Thank you for your great receipe you are an exceptionally good chef.

comments.author: Alanna
comments.content: FYI the sous vide link is broken ...

comments.author: Kathy Schpak
comments.content: Made this for Super Bowl party. Nothing left. I have been asked to bring it again for another pot luck.
